summary: The Tax Fairness for Survivors Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income any judgments, awards, and settlements related to sexual assault or sexual harassment claims. It defines such claims and directs the Secretary to issue implementing regulations. The bill also amends provisions related to social security taxes, railroad retirement tax, unemployment taxes, and wage withholding to reflect this exclusion. The amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after the bill's enactment.
